title: “Using ggdatalab” output: rmarkdown::html_vignette vignette: > % % % — ggdatalab provides ggplot2 theme colour scales.

code: library(ggplot2) library(ggdatalab)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   theme_datalab()
ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_datalab_d() +   theme_datalab()
ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = hp)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_colour_datalab_c() +   theme_datalab()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christian Knudsen. Author, maintainer.

title: Datalab ggplot2 Theme and Scales
text: ggdatalab small ggplot2 extension provides: consistent theme (theme_datalab()) discrete continuous colour scales built fixed palette simple palette helpers reuse outside ggplot package written R CMD check clean suitable CRAN submission.

title: Datalab ggplot2 Theme and Scales
text: available CRAN:

title: Datalab ggplot2 Theme and Scales
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggdatalab)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = hp)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_colour_datalab_c() +   theme_datalab()

title: Datalab ggplot2 Theme and Scales
text: theme_datalab() minimal theme based theme_minimal() restrained grid lines sensible typography defaults.

text: type "discrete" "continuous". reverse Logical. Reverse palette order.

title: Datalab palette function — datalab_pal
text: function. discrete: function(n) returns n colours. continuous: function(x) maps values [0, 1] colours.

text: ... Passed ggplot2::scale_colour_gradientn(). reverse Logical. Reverse palette order. na.value Colour missing values.
